feedbackView.successAlert: Feedback has been given. Thank you for your feedback!
feedbackView.feedbackInfo: This feedback is anonymous. Fields marked with an asterisk (*) are required
feedbackView.feedbackInfoLink: Read more, how your information and answers are being used
feedbackView.closedInfo: This feedback is currently closed. Feedback can be given between {{opensAt}} and {{closesAt}}
feedbackView.feedbackInfoContent:
The answers to the feedback are used for the improvement of courses and teaching. Your answers for the feedback may be shown to other students. The answers are always processed and shown anonymously, the teacher cannot see which student has given a certain feedback.
 The user information is used to show correct feedback surveys by using enrolment information.

feedbackTargetResults.thankYouMessage: Thank you for the feedback, here is a summary of the feedback so far.
feedbackTargetResults.closeImmediatelyConfirm: Feedback can't be collected after it is closed. Are you sure you want to close the feedback immediately?
feedbackTargetResults.closeImmediatelyTomorrowConfirm: Feedback will be closed {{date}}, so that it's open for atleast a day. Feedback can't be collected after it is closed. Are you sure you want to close the feedback immediately?

feedbackTargetResults.modalTitle: Send a reminder about feedback via email

Dear student! 
 Please give feedback for the course {{courseName}}. The feedback period ends on {{closesAt}}. Thank you!
 << The message you write will appear here >>
feedbackTargetResults.emailMessageInfo: (The preamble is translated to the student's preferred language)
feedbackTargetResults.modalSubtitle: Students who have already given feedback wont receive this email
feedbackTargetResults.hiddenInfo: This answer is hidden and is visible only to responsible teachers and programme administrators
feedbackTargetResults.publishingInfo: The answers to this questions are not shown to students. You can publish the answers to enrolled students from the button on the left titled "Not public".
feedbackTargetResults.unpublishingInfo: The answers to this questions are shown to students.
feedbackTargetResults.hidingFeatureInfo: If some answer contains personal information such as student number, or the answer is otherwise inappropriate, you can hide it with the eye-icon on the right. This has effect only when the answers are published.

groups.groupingQuestionDefaultLabel: Choose the group(s) you attended to
groups.onlyOneGroup: Only one group from SISU is available, so automatic grouping cannot be used.
groups.groupingInfoText:
Grouping allows you to see and compare answers of single SISU groups in the feedback results. Norppa automatically groups students' answers based on their confirmed study sub group. If your course does not have any meaningful study sub groups in SISU or you want the students to manually choose their group, you may create a multiple choice question and mark it as a grouping question, to have students' answers be grouped based on it. A survey may have only one grouping question and it is always the first question in the form. 

An important detail about grouping is that should any single group have 1-4 feedbacks, the grouping of results won't be available. This is to protect anonymity of students' answers. If you create your own grouping question, try not to ask too specific things or add options that might get less than 5 answers.
groups.noGroupingQuestion: The survey has no grouping question.
groups.automaticGrouping: Students' answers are automatically grouped based on their confirmed study sub group from SISU.
groups.hasGroupingQuestion: The survey has a grouping question '{{ name }}'. If you want to use automatic grouping based on SISU groups, you can delete it from below from the question's edit menu.
groups.groupsNotAvailableInfoContent: Some group(s) have between 1 and 4 feedbacks. Because of this, to protect the students' anonymity the feedbacks of any single group cannot be shown separately.
groups.groupingQuestionAddSuccess: Grouping question added with existing groups as options. You may edit it as you wish.

userInformation.iamTooltip: Showing only groups relevant to Norppa

studentsWithFeedback.cannotShowWhenOpen: The list of students who have given feedback cannot be shown while the feedback is open.
studentsWithFeedback.noFeedbackInfo: The list of students who have given feedback cannot be shown. Either there are less than five students who have given feedback or the list of students who have given feedback is disabled in the programme's settings

feedbackResponse.sendEmail: Save counter feedback and send email notification to students
feedbackResponse.responseInstruction:
Having reviewed the course feedback from students, the teacher may give a summarising response to the feedback. This feedback on feedback can be freely formulated and will be sent simultaneously to all the students on the course. 
 Your response to students is central for creating a feedback culture: it shows students that their feedback is actually read and used, which encourages them to give constructive feedback in the future.
feedbackResponse.writingInstruction: The length of the teacher’s response can vary. Examples of elements you can include in your response: thanking students for their feedback (and course participation), an overview of the feedback they gave, your subjective selection of points worth addressing, with your reactions and elaborations on them. Your concrete (planned, possible) actions to modify teaching in the course are especially valuable, showing students that giving feedback can have an impact.
feedbackResponse.dialogSendEmailContent: An email will be sent to students containing the counter feedback content and a link to the feedback. The counter feedback can be edited afterwards.
feedbackResponse.checkboxSendEmail: Send an email to all course participants
feedbackResponse.formDisabled: Counter feedback can only be given after feedback has ended

Survey already has {{count}} university level questions, but you can add additional questions. You can change the answers visibility from the 'Public'/'Not public'-button, but only if the question isn't already set as public at a higher level.

feedbackTargetView.continuousFeedbackInfo: Continuous feedback makes it possible to give free form textual feedback while the course is ongoing. Continuous feedback is active during the course, before the actual course feedback starts on the course end date.

reminderOnFeedbackToStudents.subject: Please give feedback on the course {{courseName}}

continuousFeedbackResponse.subject: Your feedback received a response on on the course {{courseName}}
continuousFeedbackResponse.text: Dear student! The teacher of the course {{courseName}} {{dates}} has responded to your continuous feedback. Response: {{response}} You can read the response here: {{courseName}}

surveyOpeningEmailToStudents.subject: Course feedback for course {{courseName}} has opened
surveyOpeningEmailToStudents.text:
Dear student,
Course feedback for the following courses are now open:
{{- courseNamesAndUrls}} Please provide feedback on the course so that we can improve teaching and University operations. Once you have completed the form, you will see a summary of your feedback. You will be able to edit your feedback as long as the form remains open.

continuousFeedbackDigest.subject: New continuous feedback on your course {{courseName}}
continuousFeedbackDigest.subjectMultiple: New continuous feedback on your courses

counterFeedbackReminder.subject: Please give counter feedback for the course {{courseName}}

counterFeedbackNotificationToStudents.subject: A new counter feedback from your teacher to course {{courseName}}
counterFeedbackNotificationToStudents.text: Dear student! The teacher of the course {{courseName}} {{dates}} has responded to the course feedback received from students. Counter feedback: {{- feedbackResponse}} You can read the course feedbacks here: {{courseName}}

reminderAboutSurveyOpeningToTeachers.subject: Feedback for the course {{courseName}} is about to start
reminderAboutSurveyOpeningToTeachers.subjectMultiple: The feedback for your courses are about to start
reminderAboutSurveyOpeningToTeachers.text:
Dear teacher!
The course feedback form for the following courses will open in a week:
{{- courseNamesAndUrls}} Please add your own questions, if any, before the above date. You can edit the questions and feedback dates by following the link. Students will receive an email notification when the feedback opens. Thank you!
$t(mails:instructionsAndSupport)
